nnetsauce.utils.matrixops.safe_sparse_dot(a, b, dense_output=False, backend='cpu')¶

Dot product that handle the sparse matrix case correctly

a : array or sparse matrix b : array or sparse matrix dense_output : boolean, (default=False)

When False, a and b both being sparse will yield sparse output. When True, output will always be a dense array.

dot_productarray or sparse matrix

sparse if a and b are sparse and dense_output=False.

nnetsauce.utils.matrixops.scale_covariates(X, choice='std', training=True, scaler=None)¶
nnetsauce.utils.matrixops.squared_norm(x)¶

Squared Euclidean or Frobenius norm of x.

Faster than norm(x) ** 2.

x : array_like

float

The Euclidean norm when x is a vector, the Frobenius norm when x is a matrix (2-d array).

nnetsauce.utils.model_selection module¶

Model selection

class nnetsauce.utils.model_selection.TimeSeriesSplit(n_splits=5, max_train_size=None)¶

Bases: sklearn.model_selection._split.TimeSeriesSplit

Time Series cross-validator

split(X, y=None, groups=None, initial_window=5, horizon=3, fixed_window=False)¶

Generate indices to split data into training and test set.

Xarray-like, shape (n_samples, n_features)

Training data, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

initial_windowint, initial number of consecutive values in each

training set sample

horizon : int, number of consecutive values in test set sample

fixed_window : boolean, if False, all training samples start at index 0

yarray-like, shape (n_samples,)

Always ignored, exists for compatibility.

groupsarray-like, with shape (n_samples,)

Always ignored, exists for compatibility.

trainndarray

The training set indices for that split.

testndarray

The testing set indices for that split.

nnetsauce.utils.progress_bar module¶

Progbar class.

class nnetsauce.utils.progress_bar.Progbar(target, width=30, verbose=1, interval=0.05, stateful_metrics=None)¶

Bases: object

Displays a progress bar.

# Arguments

target: Total number of steps expected, None if unknown. width: Progress bar width on screen. verbose: Verbosity mode, 0 (silent), 1 (verbose), 2 (semi-verbose) stateful_metrics: Iterable of string names of metrics that

should not be averaged over time. Metrics in this list will be displayed as-is. All others will be averaged by the progbar before display.

interval: Minimum visual progress update interval (in seconds).

add(n, values=None)¶
update(current, values=None)¶

Updates the progress bar.

# Arguments

current: Index of current step. values: List of tuples:

(name, value_for_last_step). If name is in stateful_metrics, value_for_last_step will be displayed as-is. Else, an average of the metric over time will be displayed.

nnetsauce.utils.psdcheck module¶

nnetsauce.utils.psdcheck.isPD(B)¶

Returns true when input is positive-definite, via Cholesky

nnetsauce.utils.psdcheck.nearestPD(A)¶

Find the nearest positive-definite matrix to input

A Python/Numpy port of John D’Errico’s nearestSPD MATLAB code [1], which credits [2].

[1] https://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/42885-nearestspd

[2] N.J. Higham, “Computing a nearest symmetric positive semidefinite matrix” (1988): https://doi.org/10.1016/0024-3795(88)90223-6

Generate indices to split data into training and test set.

Xarray-like, shape (n_samples, n_features)

Training data, where n_samples is the number of samples and n_features is the number of features.

initial_windowint, initial number of consecutive values in each

training set sample

horizon : int, number of consecutive values in test set sample

fixed_window : boolean, if False, all training samples start at index 0

Always ignored, exists for compatibility.

groupsarray-like, with shape (n_samples,)

Always ignored, exists for compatibility.

The training set indices for that split.

testndarray

The testing set indices for that split.

class nnetsauce.utils.Progbar(target, width=30, verbose=1, interval=0.05, stateful_metrics=None)¶

Bases: object

Displays a progress bar.

# Arguments

target: Total number of steps expected, None if unknown. width: Progress bar width on screen. verbose: Verbosity mode, 0 (silent), 1 (verbose), 2 (semi-verbose) stateful_metrics: Iterable of string names of metrics that

should not be averaged over time. Metrics in this list will be displayed as-is. All others will be averaged by the progbar before display.

interval: Minimum visual progress update interval (in seconds).

add(n, values=None)¶
update(current, values=None)¶

Updates the progress bar.

# Arguments

current: Index of current step. values: List of tuples:

(name, value_for_last_step). If name is in stateful_metrics, value_for_last_step will be displayed as-is. Else, an average of the metric over time will be displayed.
